column4: Hey, Can anyone give me a hand with this, I'm running ubuntu 8.10 and im trying to upgrade to 9.04 using a disk, there are a few problems though. 1)It's a mac mini with a semi stuffed internal drive(Burn't Cd's Do not read) 2) for some reason it hates mounting ISO's 3) i got an external drive working but it wont let me install from an external drive 4) i'm on dial up
- you have a live CD you are working with?
- Will your minimac boot from a usb drive?
- what size and how full is your internal drive?
- That should be more then enough room. Have you tried loading the OS onto the external drive you mentioned?
How do you mean ?
- Sorry. Got y thoughts mixed up.
- have you tried downloading the OS to your minimac directly not set up for a live cd?
- goto the Ubuntu website and look into the info they have there that would involve partitioning and installing Ubuntu in its own partition.
- this would probably setup a duel boot allowing you to choose your mac OS or Ubuntu
- OK. While running 8.10 goto your update manager and refresh it. This should tell you that 9.04 or even 10.x is available to download
- choose to download 9.04. Your system should do what needs to be done for you.
I can't download it though
- It should work of the CD you have. If not try burning a CD using a friends computer then running the new CD on your Minimac
- Have you tried burning more then one copy from your best computer?
- you said that you use dial-up right?
That's right
- What it might be is a glitch when downloading the cd to be burned. Is it possible to access a faster web connection long enough to burn another copy?
- Could your mate have had the same problem?
- maybe you minimac is just a very cranky computer that does not want to be modified... :-)
- It could have an *accident* you know... Some sort of fatal error...
Lol, How do you mean ?
- what I did with one of my old pcs... Had it encounter a large blunt object. Several times in quick succession.
- satisfaction... ;-)
